intro: Microlicia matogrossensis, commonly known as the Matogrossense microlicia, is a flowering plant native to the Brazilian Cerrado biome. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody structure, typical of many Rubiaceae species. It typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to the seasonal climate of the region. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
